item.title: This Week in Genesis (1 Oct 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
Genesis update, a promising new Genesis theme, and how to optimise your Genesis website for iPhone X.

The post This Week in Genesis (1 Oct 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Ty Carlson on Unsplash

A minor Genesis update, a promising new Genesis theme, and how to optimise your Genesis website for iPhone X.

Genesis minor update

Genesis v2.5.3 was released which ‘fixes a small bug with saving settings’.

FYI #GenesisWP 2.5.3 was released last night. Fixes a small bug when saving settings.@StudioPress Sites have been automatically upgraded!

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) September 28, 2017

Themes

Rafal Tomal and Calvin Koepke are working on a new theme.

Hey #genesiswp, here's a new theme that @cjkoepke and I are working on: https://t.co/Lqmhhm7nzo – I'm very excited about this one!

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) September 28, 2017

Showcase

Matt Whiteley for cervicide.com

Cervicide Website

Fernando Mariano with an adapation of the Aspire Pro theme for netfreelance.es

Netfreelance

Sridhar Katakam for blog.storyblocks.com

Happy to see Storyblocks blog being launched.https://t.co/va1IsayAqL

One of my largest #GenesisWP projects.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 25, 2017

Best of the rest

Ginger Coolidge shows you how to add featured posts to the Utility Pro theme.

Add Featured Post Widgets to Utility Pro

Sridhar Katakam teaches you how to add previous post and next post links to single posts in Genesis.

How to add links to Previous Post and Next Post on single Posts in Genesis:https://t.co/CRkoqnkfIK#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/rCYFf1Vktf

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 27, 2017

Anita demonstrates how to create a custom Instagram landing page in Genesis.

Create a Custom Instagram Landing Page in Genesis https://t.co/WiSuKJoqCw via @thecre8tivediva #genesiswp #wordpress #socialmedia

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) September 28, 2017

Victor Font on how to optimise your Genesis website for the forthcoming iPhone X (h/t Susan Ramsey).

Preparing Genesis Sites for the iPhone X https://t.co/p60qregOEM #GenesisWP

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) September 27, 2017

And finally…

Look out for the new ebook on improving your WordPress support from Susan Ramsey (who certainly knows a thing or two about the subject).

If I announce it on #Twitter I'm committed, right?

Look for my new ebook – A guide to #WordPress support success. #GenesisWP

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) September 29, 2017

—

That’s all for this week, except for my usual reminders that, if you don’t want to miss these updates in future, you can subscribe below. And, if you’d like to add something for consideration in next week’s update you can add your submission right on this very website. Have a great week.

The post This Week in Genesis (1 Oct 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.

item.title: This Week in Genesis (24 Sep 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
New themes, everyone’s doing CSS Grid and tutorials galore.

The post This Week in Genesis (24 Sep 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Ruth Troughton on Unsplash

New themes, everyone’s doing CSS Grid and tutorials galore.

Themes

StudioPress release the perfect theme for your next product or service idea, Business Pro.

Introducing the Business Pro theme — https://t.co/JHUiwpDGbI (via @seothemeswp) #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/guqbdLGy3X

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 20, 2017

And Calvin Koepke is already teasing their next one.

Brewing up something a little new and fun for you in our newest @studiopress theme. You'll just have to wait and see. #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) September 19, 2017

ZigZagPress announce their 38th theme, interiorr.

Announcing our 38th #genesiswp theme: interiorr!
It’s perfect for flexible, minimalist branding, includes ecommercehttps://t.co/k5gu8KKCpg

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) September 22, 2017

Showcase

Gordon Seirup for vlader.com

Just launched today…! https://t.co/lbjhAdfCOd Mobile-first theme on the #genesiswp Framework. @studiopress #WordPress #wine #napavalley

— Gordon Seirup (@CopperGordon) September 19, 2017

Podcasts

Tonya Mork explains how to change the CreativeWork microdata in Genesis to book, music, or recipe in her Ask Tonya podcast.

Here's how to change the "CreativeWork" microdata to book, music, or recipe in your #GenesisWP theme https://t.co/aAtxEf3LYD

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) September 21, 2017

Best of the rest

Sridhar Katakam launches a new skeleton plugin for amending the output of the Genesis – Featured Page widget.

Custom Genesis – Featured Page Widget plugin:https://t.co/mC0syh6FHm#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) September 21, 2017

Matt Whiteley officially kicks off his GenesisWP CSS Grid project, GenGrid.

The #genesiswp #cssgrid project is fully underway. Hoping to have 1st version done this week and on Github! https://t.co/TBgdbjm9B9

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) September 18, 2017

The initials #genesiswp #cssgrid starter theme is up – https://t.co/jgEfIBjVVA – No responsive work on it yet…getting there!

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) September 19, 2017

I’m a big fan of this approach and so I’m delighted to see Craig Simpson explaining how to extend your Genesis theme with add_theme_support (h/t Sal).

Extending your Genesis theme with add_theme_support() https://t.co/UV4opSGjNX #GenesisWP via @craigsimps

— Sal Ferrarello (@salcode) September 21, 2017

The latest tutorial from the StudioPress blog shows you how to showcase a grid of photos on your homepage.

Showcase a Grid of Photos on Your Homepage —> https://t.co/Zgx9IGBIsB #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/CzYp2vP7lB

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 22, 2017

LeagueWP walks you through how to display related posts with CSS Grid in Genesis.

How to Display Related Posts with CSS Grid in #genesiswp #cssgrid #WordPress

https://t.co/G4wAmLUM10

— League WP (@league_wp) September 20, 2017

Anita shows you how to add a colour selector to the Maker Pro theme.

#TipsyTuesday is back! Add Color Selector to Maker Pro Child Theme https://t.co/bKqT4h7mi0 #genesiswp #photographers #webdev #tips

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) September 19, 2017

And finally…

Don’t drive yourself crazy, ask.

The act of asking someone else the question kicks in those brain cells, and you can figure out the solution yourself.#GenesisWP #Coding

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) September 16, 2017

That’s all for this week. Got something awesome to share? Add it to the site. Enjoy these weekly updates? Subscribe below (and never miss another edition).

The post This Week in Genesis (24 Sep 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.

Chris Hufnagel for culer.com (h/t Brian Gardner)

What a gorgeous Genesis website —> https://t.co/LbKnnY8hvd (props @ChrisHufnagel) #genesiswp

— Soulheart (@soulheartco) September 6, 2017

Tony Eppright for realityhomesinc.com

Launched our latest #genesiswp responsive custom website https://t.co/R4ZhaysMhm #wordpress #website @studiopress pic.twitter.com/Ot75DfHXRb

Dom Wint for robertwhetham.co.uk

Jackie D’Elia chats Genesis and more with Cathi Bosco and Joe Dooley on episode 22 of Rethink.fm.

Brian Gardner teaches you how to add an Instagram feed to your site footer.

How to Add an Instagram Feed to Your Site Footer —> https://t.co/i9yV8xI93w #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/dyTpKG6YZv

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 8, 2017

Elizabeth Jamieson shows you how to restyle the Genesis menus in Aspire Pro.

Restyle Genesis menus on Aspire Pro #genesiswp https://t.co/8iYz13prgG

item.title: This Week in Genesis (3 Sep 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
A new storefront theme from StudioPress, 13 StudioPress themes get updates, plus how to make an animated hamburger menu in Genesis.

The post This Week in Genesis (3 Sep 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Storefrontin’ (Photo by Lance Anderson on Unsplash)

A new storefront theme from StudioPress to sell all your things, 13 StudioPress themes get updates, plus how to make an animated hamburger menu in Genesis.

Themes

StudioPress launch a sharp new storefront theme, Outfitter Pro (demo). Designed by Lauren Mancke, it’s built to work with WooCommerce right out of the gate.

Introducing Outfitter Pro—a striking new storefront theme for Genesis —> https://t.co/YW0ulWP1J8 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/YGgeBbIUdA

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 31, 2017

Plus, Jodi Stammer and Sridhar Katakam report that 13 StudioPress child themes were updated this week.

13 #GenesisWP child themes were updated yesterday/today.https://t.co/0Jbhu8wC2i

via @jstammer

Changes can be seen in README.txt inside.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 30, 2017

I only checked two themes quickly but it looks like mainly WooCommerce related improvements.

Showcase

Nice clean site from Kevin Donnigan for firehawkskids.com

New #wordpress #genesiswp website- #CrossFit Kids & Teens at CrossFit Hellbox from @anythinggraphic with @luckytamm https://t.co/z8PPCnaTRb pic.twitter.com/i7Sj9vpuoA

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) August 30, 2017

Solid site on the Aspire theme by Ruby Slipper Designs for womensleadershipconference.net

Wow! Check out this amazing site @rubyslipperweb built with the Aspire Theme! https://t.co/yTAMrut1Ak#genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/vYlfoWjs0R

— appfinite (@appfinite) August 30, 2017

Tutorials

Jackie D’Elia demonstrates how to add SVG icons and graphics to your WordPress theme.

Adding SVG icons and graphics to your theme

Susan Ramsey shows you how to style the Simple Social Icons plugin.

On the blog today in my #Genesis4Beginners series. How to Style the Simple Social Icons. #GenesisWP #WordPresshttps://t.co/hJ29Ib4NL1 pic.twitter.com/xbBbSgFzla

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) August 31, 2017

Sridhar Katakam tells you how to make an animated hamburger menu in Genesis.

Animated Hamburger Menu Icon in Genesis:https://t.co/XiWUnbhzdk#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/LUlyTMtUJB

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 28, 2017

Brian Gardner on how to add TypeKit fonts to your Genesis site. (Plus, he also shares the news that you can now apparently do this with CSS only, no JavaScript).

Quick Tip: How to Add Typekit Fonts to Your Genesis Website —> https://t.co/HjA7fR5qmm #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/eeXWHyBUcm

— StudioPress (@studiopress) September 1, 2017

—

That’s all for this week. Got something awesome to share? Add it to the site. Enjoy these weekly updates? Subscribe below (and never miss another edition again).

item.title: This Week in Genesis (27 Aug 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
Genesis starter theme with CSS Grid support, updates to the Genesis Simple Share plugin, and your opportunity to guest edit This Week in Genesis.

The post This Week in Genesis (27 Aug 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Braden Collum on Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, a Genesis starter theme with CSS Grid support, updates to the Genesis Simple Share plugin, and your opportunity to guest edit This Week in Genesis.

Themes

One for the devs amongst you, Sridhar Katakam launches v2.3.0 of his Genesis Starter theme (based on v2.3.0 of the popular Genesis Sample theme).

It features Theme Logo support, inline navigation menu, CSS Grid support for structural elements, mobile first CSS and more.

Genesis Starter 2.3.0:https://t.co/9kw7vsKOWd#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 23, 2017

Plus, if you’re interested in discussing future improvements to the Genesis Sample theme, there’s a new channel (#sample) in Slack just for you.

We have a new channel in GenesisWP Slack named #sample for those interested in improving Genesis Sample w/ CSS Grid/Flexbox etc.

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 22, 2017

Showcase

Great site from Kraig Mathias for erinpalinski.com

Hot off the press! Brand new, custom #genesiswp website for #nutrition expert @erinpalinski! Check it out here: https://t.co/mp4pQQvOUU pic.twitter.com/5eBTSFBk2h

— Kraig Mathias (@KraigMathias) August 21, 2017

Joelle Cottle with a redesign for craigchoffe.com

Website Redesign

Best of the rest

Nick Croft is looking for feedback on the latest version of the Genesis Simple Share plugin.

Got a RC for #GenesisWP Simple Share. Adds some long awaited features and I'd love feedback. https://t.co/LNF8czWEf0

— Nick Croft (@Nick_theGeek) August 23, 2017

Susan Ramsey shows you how to add a front page to the Pretty Happy theme from Pretty Darn Cute.

Another tutorial in my #Genesis4Beginners series: Customizing the Pretty Happy #GenesisWP #WordPress theme: https://t.co/ThocyZ2cFn pic.twitter.com/QJMNrWIsFF

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) August 23, 2017

When he’s not launching a new Genesis starter theme, Sridhar Katakam is also taking the time to show you how to add a slider in Minimum Pro’s front page.

How to add a slider in Minimum Pro's front page:https://t.co/wgJerx7GyG#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/u387oRCL9A

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 22, 2017

And finally…

I’m thinking of opening up This Week in Genesis to guest editors again. If you’d like to put yourself forward to write an edition just fill out this form.

Guest Edit

If you’ve previously guest edited and you’d like to do it again, either fill out the form (if you really like filling out forms) or drop me an email.

—

That’s all for this week.

Got something awesome to share? Add it to the site.

Enjoy these weekly updates? Subscribe below (and never miss another edition again).

The post This Week in Genesis (27 Aug 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.

item.title: This Week in Genesis (20 Aug 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
Sridhar Katakam tackles CSS Grid, new themes (including a discount), plus a new plugin from Calvin Koepke.

The post This Week in Genesis (20 Aug 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Pete Wright on Unsplash

This week in Genesis, Sridhar Katakam tackles CSS Grid, new themes (including a discount), plus a new plugin from Calvin Koepke.

Themes

Lee Anthony over at SEO Themes launches Business Pro, a stylish new Genesis child theme.

Introducing Business Pro – A clean and modern #genesiswp theme designed for businesses of any kind https://t.co/0YUS2By2rQ #WordPress pic.twitter.com/XOpsKw1Cx1

— SEO Themes (@seothemeswp) August 16, 2017

There’s also a discount of 20% off for a (presumably) limited time, using code BIZPRO20OFF.

SAVE 20% on our brand new #genesiswp theme Business Pro with the discount code BIZPRO20OFF https://t.co/0YUS2By2rQ

— SEO Themes (@seothemeswp) August 17, 2017

Maira Gallardo shares a new theme, Georgia

Check out Georgia, a #GenesisWP theme for virtual assistants, personal stylists, business coaches & more. https://t.co/0JrGo4vohl #wordpress pic.twitter.com/BDFsxHj5tu

— Maira Gallardo (@immairagall) August 19, 2017

Showcase

Cute new e-commerce site from Maira Gallardo for tienda.airesdebohemia.com.ar

Aires de Bohemia Ecommerce

Best of the rest

Calvin Koepke (with help from a few other people) launches a new Genesis Simple FAQ plugin with a focus on accessibility and performance.

Need an accessible, performant tabs plugin? We just released a beta version for the Genesis Framework –> https://t.co/ySSW2JGMiV #wordpress

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) August 18, 2017

Props to @dreamwhisper and @nathanrice for helping, and @10up for providing excellent documentation on accessibility standards.

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) August 18, 2017

(And if you were a member of the Facebook group you might’ve heard about it first).

We just dropped a treat in the #genesiswp Facebook group. Join now for access —> https://t.co/GCyvTey3Ta

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 17, 2017

Sridhar Katakam with some helpful new tutorials, Posts Grid in Genesis using Grid CSS.

Posts Grid in Genesis using CSS Grid:https://t.co/usPgGJS4Qg#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/3dnZaNiN5e

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 17, 2017

And, how to show featured image of latest post for each unique posts published year in WordPress/Genesis (and, yes, I had to read that twice):

How to show featured image of latest post for each unique posts published year in WordPress/Genesis:https://t.co/WWMw8h36vX#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/WpSaHEm5wx

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 18, 2017

And finally…

The only thing (possibly) more exciting that the release of a new Genesis plugin, a new addition to the family. Congrats Calvin!

Welcomed my third boy today: Eidan (eye-den) Clay Koepke. Love these first moments. Also, his name means “fire”. How uncanny is that?! pic.twitter.com/twf5FGvakA

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) August 20, 2017

—

That’s all for this week. Done something awesome? Share it via the homepage.

The post This Week in Genesis (20 Aug 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.

item.title: This Week in Genesis (13 Aug 2017)

item.description:

item.content:encoded:
Photo by Gerrie van der Walt on Unsplash

New theme release from Restored 316 and a new theme sneak peek from StudioPress.

Themes

Lauren Gaige at Restored 316 launches a new theme for bloggers, Captivating.

We are so excited to introduce our new theme Captivating, A WordPress theme built for bloggers. https://t.co/rfQxIP7WWn #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/1Ci9PeZSCH

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) August 9, 2017

Rafal Tomal gives a sneak peek at the latest theme in works from StudioPress (design by Lauren Mancke).

Here's a sneak preview at the new #genesiswp theme we're working on at @StudioPress: https://t.co/LghLlkqkbX

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) August 11, 2017

And finally…

If you want to learn CSS Grid but don’t know where to start you might want to try Grid Garden (h/t Sridhar).

item.title: This Week in Genesis (6 Aug 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
New themes to fire your creativity on StudioPress and WP Studio.

The post This Week in Genesis (6 Aug 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Photo by Jacob Kiesow

New themes to fire your creativity on StudioPress and WP Studio. Plus, details of a Genesis Meetup planned for WordCamp Manchester (UK).

Themes

StudioPress release their latest theme, Boss Pro (demo), a third party theme made by the folk at Bloom.

Introducing Boss Pro: Turn Your Dreams Into Plans

See it here: https://t.co/PNoFGfzP6s#genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 2, 2017

The latest theme from Frank at WP Studio is out and, as usual, it doesn’t disappoint. Havana (demo) is a portfolio theme for ‘photographers and creative minds’.

Say hello to Havana A #GenesisWP Portfolio Theme for Photographers and Creative Minds #WordPress #wordpressthemes https://t.co/NIpD3cbmUu pic.twitter.com/2hgOjkJoUk

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) July 31, 2017

Showcase

Bill Erickson for solutionsiq.com

Excited to launch @SolutionsIQ new website! Check it out: https://t.co/jaw752vU23

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) August 3, 2017

Spinifex Media for soulsurftravel.com

Our biggest project to date, we're stoked to launch this rebuild of https://t.co/vco8GpqlCZ Lots of love, ACF, and of course #genesiswp! pic.twitter.com/DzU1hb6z3l

— Spinifex Media (@spnfxmedia) August 1, 2017

Claire Cheyne with a new site for swmummy.co.uk

New project launch for SW Mummy this week. Using the amazing combo of #genesiswp and @BeaverBuilder https://t.co/M2Tz512GpS pic.twitter.com/XDRtpK2fXT

— Claire Cheyne (@wildflowerspix) August 5, 2017

Matt Whiteley, who many of you will know for his Genesis themes, has redesigned his site, whiteleydesigns.com

The facelift for my #genesiswp site is complete and the deployment is done! Easier navigation and more white space. https://t.co/kFKpzJZBNb pic.twitter.com/kbqMTe3XU3

— Matt Whiteley (@whiteleydesigns) July 31, 2017

Best of the rest

Srihar Katakam shows you how to use FacetWP (one of my favorite plugins) and WooCommerce together.

@FacetWP + #WooCommerce in #GenesisWP:https://t.co/M2rT9NHEKS pic.twitter.com/66Oa2NbdDd

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 5, 2017

Bill Erickson spoke at Post Status’ Publish conference on making your freelancing business more profitable.

Great interview w/ Bill Erickson @BillErickson by @Krogsgard at #publishconf #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/EpcBINHPV3

— Birgit Pauli-Haack (@bph) August 3, 2017

And finally…

If you’re going to WordCamp Manchester be sure to go to the UK Genesis meetup on 27 October (and make sure you book in advance).

Going to WordCamp Manchester?

Use the Genesis Framework?

Come to our #UKGenesis meetup!https://t.co/pVQjj2eaH8#genesiswp #wcmcr

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) July 31, 2017

That’s all for this week.

Got something to share? Post it via the homepage.

Want to join the cool kids? I can’t help you with that, but you can subscribe.

item.title: These Weeks in Genesis (30 Jul 2017)
item.dc:creator: Nick Davis
item.description:
After an unexpected summer 'break', we're back with a splash with a new theme and a new podcast from the community.

The post These Weeks in Genesis (30 Jul 2017) appeared first on GenesisWP.guide.
item.content:encoded:
Back with a splash… (photo by Jakob Owens)

After an unexpected summer ‘break’ for the last two weeks, this week I’m covering all my favourite happenings since the last edition (9 July 2017), including a new theme, a podcast and more.

Themes

Lindsey Riel launches a new travel blogger theme, Travel Pretty (demo).

Travel Pretty is all packed up and ready! https://t.co/rdvKwFwgs4 #travelblogger

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) July 24, 2017

And Susan Ramsey is doing a special offer for Travel Pretty theme setup and logo design.

To celebrate the launch of #TravelPretty, I'm offering a theme setup including #logo design! #GenesisWP https://t.co/NW8JTDaSlA pic.twitter.com/wsIvTefAtS

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 24, 2017

Your occasional reminder that Wes Straham is still offering buy one, get one free on all his Genesis themes over at Appfinite.

Looking for a Premium #GenesisWp Theme?

Here’s your chance to Buy One Get One Free! https://t.co/WFnVeIM3cy #WordPress #marketing #wp pic.twitter.com/MlOiIA5VIg

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) July 21, 2017

Podcasts & Talks

Tonya Mork of Know The Code has started a podcast! And on this episode of Ask Tonya she’s exploring microdata in Genesis.

[NEW] What if your content is a book, recipe, or music? How do you change the microdata in #GenesisWP? https://t.co/eJuq6KfTS3

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) July 19, 2017

Stephanie Hellwig recently spoke at WordCamp San Diego and her talk – 10 ways to provide great support – based on lessons learnt from running her successful Genesis theme shop [EDIT: 2 Aug 2017] the successful example of the Restored 316 theme shop, is now available at WordPress.tv

That time I spoke at WCSD. . . https://t.co/aKVgYrMd5y #wordpress #genesiswp #keepLearning #Entrepreneur

— Stephanie Hellwig (@stephanehellwig) July 12, 2017

Hallway Chats talks Genesis and more with Sara Dunn.

Thank you thank you to @HallwayChats for inviting me to be a guest! https://t.co/LSKAfw8fYa

— Sara Dunn (@Sara11D) July 13, 2017

Tutorials

Sridhar Katakam shows how you set to up flexible widget areas in any Genesis theme.

How to set up Flexible Widgets in any Genesis child theme:https://t.co/Um2uqnqNVw#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/3Sxyj1A5RM

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 12, 2017

Plus, how to link your site description to your homepage in Genesis.

How to link Tagline to Site URL in Genesis:https://t.co/IO6tnQqyPJ#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/6LR0ZKbqNs

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 17, 2017

Tonya Mork explains exactly what the genesis() function does.

Video series walking you through the #GenesisWP framework. Find out exactly what the genesis(); function does https://t.co/HZah1xS7A8

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) July 9, 2017

Best of the rest

Congrats to Remkus de Vries and his son Roan on the launch of their new project, allgenesisthemes.com.

It's happening! Please welcome @Roan_v, my son, to the #GenesisWP world with our project. Still lots to do, but this is his first post https://t.co/S6KcmoZQUF

— Remkus de Vries (@DeFries) July 11, 2017

Interesting new flexible, custom post type plugin, Genesis Communities CPT Plugin, from Jackie D’Elia.

Genesis Communities CPT Plugin

Scott DeLuzio shares a new plugin that lets you exclude a category from the Genesis Featured Posts widget.

I just made a plugin for #genesiswp that lets you exclude a category from the Featured Posts widget https://t.co/nycAwWw6dg

— Scott DeLuzio (@scottdeluzio) July 14, 2017

And finally…

Huge congrats to the all hard working folk who run the Genesis Facebook Group, which just hit 8,000 members. If you’re not already part of it, why not join today.

We hit 8,000 members in the Facebook #GenesisWP group today:https://t.co/20uFgmY1cy #WordPress @studiopress pic.twitter.com/uCERroWSrV

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 21, 2017

item.content:encoded:
Photo via New Lungs For Me

Remembering Jesse Petersen.

Jesse Petersen, 1978-2017

I’m sure that most, if not all, of you reading this have already heard the sad news about Jesse Petersen’s passing on Wednesday after his brave battle with cystic fibrosis.

It is a mark of the respect and love in which he was held by the community, to see so many tributes to the man on Twitter, Facebook and elsewhere.

1/ My heart breaks to hear of the loss of a good friend @jpetersen. He truly was one of the good guys.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) July 6, 2017

Jesse was a prominent member of the #genesiswp community, and doing amazing things in life – I'm so sad he's gone.https://t.co/1CeLLJ6cQ7

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) July 6, 2017

I am better off having known you, Jesse. Godspeed.@jpetersen #gonetoosoon https://t.co/QIJT0IwN0b

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 5, 2017

I have no words. I’m heartbroken. Prayers to @jpetersen’s family. See you on the other side. https://t.co/jKzZt2JQq9 #genesiswp

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) July 5, 2017

Such sad news. I didn't expect anything to be able to stop him. I enjoyed our early #genesiswp days. RIP friend. https://t.co/DFxG4OQ7ab

— Brandon Kraft (@Kraft) July 5, 2017

My heart hurts for @jpetersen and his entire family… He contributed a great deal to the WordPress community & is already missed

— Jennifer Bourn (@jenniferbourn) July 5, 2017

Met @jpetersen on multiple occasions. Family man and proud dad. Always respected the hell outta that. See you on the flip side, buddy.

— Jared Atchison (@jaredatch) July 5, 2017

Through tears, I ask for retweets, likes, shares, all of it. https://t.co/i6AY06Jn3S

— Ben Meredith (@benUNC) July 5, 2017

Gone, but not lost: In remembrance of Jesse Petersen https://t.co/VfiVyzRLUX #RIPJesse

— Post Status (@post_status) July 6, 2017

I’m not sure what I can add to those, particularly to those who knew him in person.

So I’ll just say that I was lucky enough to know Jesse from the first few months I started playing around with Genesis around five or six years ago.

I had no clue what I was doing, but that even though I was a ‘nobody’ in the community and he was a Genesis contributor, preferred developer and all round Genesis rockstar, he was decent enough to follow me back on Twitter.

I remember the great WordSesh presentation he did in what was the middle of the night for him (on his time zone).

Starting a #GenesisWP tribe with him in Clash of Clans (we were the only two members).

And, most recently, after sending my newsletter every week getting an ‘out of office’ message from Jesse with a clear note in it about the days and hours you should expect a reply from him.

And it always makes me smile because I know how organised he is in his business about setting client expectations and all those other things I should take more care of myself. So even though it was just an out of office message, it was a little bit of Jesse’s personality in my inbox every week.

Out of office message or not, every time I send this weekly newsletter from now on I’ll be thinking of him.

Please help if you can

Jesse was 38 and survived by his wife and two children. As a cystic fibrosis sufferer Jesse was unable to get life insurance so a fund has been set up to help his family.

If you’d like to help Jesse’s family you can do so via the fund.

Please consider helping Jesse's family – his wife and two young boys need our help: https://t.co/Xf599mFemG#GenesisWP #WordPress https://t.co/4afv3PP36P

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 5, 2017

RIP Jesse, you did everything that you could.

I’m glad to call you a friend.

Can you look over your life and say you’d be leaving those connected to you better off having known you? If not, start today.

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) July 3, 2017

Current status: at Starbucks with @RafalTomal designing the next @studiopress theme. #genesiswp
